name: Gulf Stream Flounder
sciName:
Citharichthys arctifrons Goode, 1880			
			
				Gulf Stream flounder

sectionData.Classification: Actinopteri (ray-finned fishes) > Pleuronectiformes (Flatfishes) > Cyclopsettidae (Sand whiffs) Etymology: Citharichthys: Latin, cithara = lire like instrument + Greek, ichthys = fish (Ref. 45335). More on author: Goode.
sectionData.Environment: Marine; demersal; depth range 46 - 366 m (Ref. 5951). Subtropical; 45°N - 21°N
sectionData.Distribution: Western Atlantic: Georges Bank to southern Florida, USA and eastern Gulf of Mexico from Florida to Yucatan, Mexico.
sectionData.Biology: Occurs in deeper water. Rarely found in shallow water.
sectionData.Life cycle: Distinct pairing (Ref. 205). Oviparous (Ref. 101737). Females produce numerous eggs in multiple spawnings during a prolonged spawning period (Ref. 101737).
